definitions: person born in or inhabiting the Brittany region of northwestern France
Celtic language spoken in Brittany, closely related to Welsh and Cornish
examples: The Breton fisherman shared stories of his coastal village
Many Bretons maintain strong cultural traditions despite modern influences
She studied Breton to connect with her ancestral heritage
Road signs in Brittany display both French and Breton languages

definitions: woman on her wedding day or just before and after the marriage ceremony
examples: The bride wore her grandmother's pearl necklace with her dress
All eyes turned as the bride walked down the aisle
The bride and groom exchanged heartfelt vows during the ceremony
Family members helped the bride prepare for her special day

definitions: soft French cheese with white edible rind made from cow's milk
examples: The brie melted perfectly on the warm baguette slices
She served brie with crackers and fig jam at the party
This aged brie has developed complex flavors over several months
The cheese board featured brie alongside cheddar and blue cheese

definitions: informal term for person from Britain or the United Kingdom
examples: The Brit explained cricket rules to his American colleagues
Many Brits enjoy afternoon tea as a cultural tradition
She met several Brits during her travels through Southeast Asia
The pub was popular with Brits living abroad in Dubai

definitions: male person having the same parents or parent as another person
male member of a religious order or congregation who is not ordained
fellow member of a group, organization, or shared identity or experience
examples: My brother taught me how to ride a bicycle
The two brothers started a business together after college
Brother Francis tended the monastery garden with devoted care
The brothers gathered for morning prayers in the chapel
He called his fraternity brothers to organize the reunion event
The union brothers stood together during the labor dispute

definitions: dark color produced by mixing red, yellow, and black pigments
common English-language surname of Anglo-Saxon and Scottish origin
examples: The brown leather jacket matched his boots perfectly
Autumn leaves turned various shades of brown and gold
Professor Brown published groundbreaking research on climate change
The Browns invited their neighbors for a backyard barbecue

definitions: square or rectangular chocolate cake typically containing nuts and having fudgy texture
member of the youngest section of Girl Guides or Girl Scouts aged 6-8
examples: The warm brownie topped with vanilla ice cream was irresistible
She added walnuts to her brownie recipe for extra crunch
The Brownie earned her first badge by helping elderly neighbors
Local Brownies sold cookies to raise funds for camping trips

definitions: adult male deer, antelope, rabbit, or similar animal
informal term for one United States dollar
spirited or fashionable young man, especially in historical contexts
examples: The buck stood majestically at the forest clearing edge
Hunters tracked the buck through fresh snow for hours
This coffee costs three bucks at the corner shop
He made a quick buck selling vintage items online
The young buck strutted confidently into the dance hall
Local bucks competed for attention at the county fair

definitions: North American tree or shrub with showy flower clusters and glossy brown seeds
informal term for native or resident of Ohio state
examples: The buckeye tree produces distinctive nuts resembling deer eyes
Children collected buckeye seeds for their natural science project
The Buckeyes cheered loudly for their Ohio State football team
As a proud Buckeye, she displayed Ohio memorabilia throughout her office

definitions: major world religion and philosophy based on teachings of Siddhartha Gautama emphasizing liberation from suffering through enlightenment
examples: Buddhism spread from India throughout Asia over many centuries
She studied Buddhism to understand mindfulness and meditation practices
Modern Buddhism encompasses diverse schools including Theravada and Mahayana traditions
The core of Buddhism lies in the Four Noble Truths

definitions: person who follows or practices the religion and philosophy of Buddhism
examples: The Buddhist monk meditated silently in the temple garden
Many Buddhists gather weekly for dharma talks and group practice
She became a Buddhist after years of spiritual searching
Tibetan Buddhists celebrate Losar as their new year festival

definitions: large bovine animal native to North America or Asia with massive head and shoulders
major city in western New York state near Niagara Falls
examples: The buffalo herd thundered across the Great Plains grasslands
Native Americans relied on buffalo for food, clothing, and shelter
Buffalo experiences heavy snowfall due to lake effect weather
The company relocated its headquarters to Buffalo last year

definitions: adult male of domestic cattle or certain other large animals
investor who expects market prices to rise and buys accordingly
official papal letter or document sealed with a bulla
examples: The bull charged aggressively when strangers approached the pasture
Farmers separated the bull from the cows during breeding season
The bull market continued for three consecutive years of growth
Bulls dominated trading as tech stocks reached record highs
The papal bull established new regulations for monastic orders
Medieval bulls were written in Latin on parchment documents

definitions: round flat cake of minced meat or vegetables typically served in a bun
examples: The restaurant serves burgers with homemade brioche buns daily
She ordered a veggie burger with sweet potato fries
Gourmet burgers have become increasingly popular in urban restaurants
The classic burger includes lettuce, tomato, and special sauce

definitions: wine-producing region in eastern France famous for red and white wines
deep reddish-purple color resembling the wine from Burgundy region
historical duchy and kingdom in western Europe centered in eastern France
examples: This burgundy comes from premier cru vineyards near Beaune
Wine collectors prize aged burgundy for its complex flavors
She chose burgundy curtains to complement the room's warm tones
The bridesmaids wore elegant burgundy dresses for the autumn wedding
The Duke of Burgundy wielded significant power in medieval Europe
Burgundy played a crucial role in fifteenth-century European politics

definitions: prickly seed case or flower head that clings to fur or clothing
rough edge or ridge left on metal or other material after cutting
rough or rolling pronunciation of the letter 'r' in speech
examples: Burrs stuck to the dog's fur during the forest walk
She carefully removed burrs from her wool sweater
The machinist filed away burrs from the newly cut metal piece
Quality control checks for burrs on manufactured components
His Scottish burr became more pronounced when he was excited
The actor perfected a Highland burr for the historical drama

definitions: woody plant smaller than tree with several stems arising from base
wild or uncultivated country, especially in Australia, Africa, or Alaska
American political family surname including two U.S. presidents
examples: The rose bush bloomed profusely throughout the summer months
Birds nested in the dense bush near the garden fence
They spent weeks trekking through the Australian bush
Rangers patrol the bush to prevent poaching and wildfires
President Bush addressed the nation during the crisis
The Bush family has deep roots in Texas politics

definitions: traditional code of honor and morals followed by Japanese samurai emphasizing loyalty, courage, and self-discipline
examples: Bushido influenced Japanese military culture for many centuries
The seven virtues of bushido include righteousness, courage, and honor
Modern martial arts still incorporate bushido principles in training
He studied bushido to understand traditional Japanese warrior philosophy

definitions: member of indigenous peoples of southern Africa, particularly the San people
person skilled at living or traveling in wild or remote country
examples: The Bushman shared traditional knowledge about desert survival techniques
Bushman rock art provides insights into ancient African cultures
The experienced bushman guided tourists through remote wilderness areas
Local bushmen know every water source in the region

definitions: chief male servant of a household who manages other servants and household affairs
examples: The butler announced each guest as they arrived at the mansion
In Victorian times, the butler held the highest servant position
The hotel butler provided personalized service to suite guests
She hired a butler to manage her estate's daily operations

definitions: isolated hill with steep sides and flat top, smaller than mesa, common in western North America
examples: The red sandstone butte rose dramatically from the desert floor
Native Americans considered certain buttes sacred ceremonial sites
Photographers gathered at sunrise to capture the butte's silhouette
Erosion gradually shaped the butte over millions of years

definitions: relating to Byzantium or the Eastern Roman Empire from 4th to 15th century
excessively complicated, detailed, or devious in character or organization
examples: Byzantine art featured distinctive religious icons and golden mosaics
The Byzantine Empire lasted for over a thousand years
The company's byzantine approval process frustrated many employees
Navigating the byzantine regulations required expert legal assistance

definitions: man who behaves dishonorably, especially toward women
computer-aided design software used for technical drawings and modeling
examples: The cad abandoned her after promising marriage
Victorian novels often featured cads as antagonists
Engineers use CAD to create precise technical drawings
The new CAD software improved our design workflow significantly

definitions: small domesticated carnivorous mammal kept as a pet
informal term for a jazz musician or enthusiast
examples: The cat purred contentedly while sleeping in the sunny window
Our cat catches mice in the barn regularly
That cool cat plays saxophone at the downtown jazz club
The cats gathered for an all-night jam session

definitions: complete blood count medical test measuring various blood components
Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Canada's national public broadcaster
examples: The doctor ordered a CBC to check for infection markers
Her CBC results showed slightly elevated white blood cells
CBC News covered the election results throughout the night
The CBC broadcasts programs in both English and French

definitions: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the United States federal public health agency
examples: The CDC issued new guidelines for preventing disease transmission
Researchers at the CDC track infectious disease outbreaks globally
CDC recommendations influence public health policies across the nation
The CDC headquarters in Atlanta employs thousands of scientists

definitions: Chief Executive Officer, the highest-ranking executive in a company responsible for major corporate decisions
examples: The CEO presented the quarterly earnings to shareholders yesterday
She became CEO after twenty years with the company
The board hired a new CEO to lead the restructuring effort
As CEO, he transformed the startup into a global corporation

definitions: chlorofluorocarbon, synthetic compound formerly used in refrigeration and aerosols, now banned for damaging ozone
examples: CFCs were phased out globally through the Montreal Protocol
Scientists discovered CFCs were depleting the atmospheric ozone layer
Old refrigerators may still contain CFCs requiring special disposal
The ban on CFCs helped the ozone layer begin recovering

definitions: compact fluorescent lamp, energy-efficient light bulb using fluorescent technology
Canadian Football League, professional football league in Canada
examples: CFL bulbs use less electricity than traditional incandescent bulbs
She replaced all fixtures with CFL bulbs to reduce energy costs
The CFL championship game is called the Grey Cup
Several CFL players later succeeded in the NFL

definitions: Chief Financial Officer, senior executive responsible for managing company financial actions and planning
examples: The CFO reported strong revenue growth to the board
Our CFO oversees accounting, treasury, and financial planning departments
The new CFO implemented cost-cutting measures across all divisions
As CFO, she managed the company's successful IPO process

definitions: Central Intelligence Agency, the foreign intelligence service of the United States government
examples: The CIA gathers intelligence on foreign threats to national security
Former CIA analysts wrote extensively about intelligence operations
CIA headquarters in Langley houses thousands of intelligence professionals
The CIA director briefed Congress on emerging security challenges

definitions: Chief Information Officer, executive responsible for information technology and computer systems strategy
Congress of Industrial Organizations, former American labor federation that merged with AFL
examples: The CIO oversees all technology infrastructure and cybersecurity initiatives
Our CIO is leading the digital transformation project
The CIO organized millions of industrial workers in the 1930s
John Lewis led the CIO during its formative years

definitions: Common Business-Oriented Language, early high-level programming language designed for business data processing
examples: Many banks still maintain legacy systems written in COBOL
She learned COBOL to maintain the company's accounting software
COBOL programmers are in demand for maintaining older systems
The payroll system was originally developed in COBOL decades ago

definitions: central or most important part of something
muscles of torso including abdominals and back supporting spine and pelvis
individual processing unit within a computer processor
examples: The core of the apple contains seeds for reproduction
Trust forms the core of any healthy relationship
Strengthening your core improves posture and prevents back pain
Pilates focuses heavily on core muscle development
This laptop has an eight-core processor for faster performance
Each core can handle multiple computing tasks simultaneously

definitions: Certified Public Accountant, licensed professional qualified to offer accounting services to the public
examples: The CPA prepared our company's tax returns and financial statements
She passed all four CPA exam sections on her first attempt
Small businesses often hire a CPA for tax planning advice
The CPA audit confirmed the accuracy of financial records

definitions: Consumer Price Index, measure of average change in prices paid by consumers for goods and services
examples: The CPI rose by 2.5 percent indicating moderate inflation
Economists monitor CPI to assess cost of living changes
Social Security benefits are adjusted annually based on CPI
The Federal Reserve considers CPI when setting interest rates

definitions: cardiopulmonary resuscitation, emergency procedure combining chest compressions and artificial ventilation to maintain blood flow
examples: The lifeguard performed CPR on the drowning victim immediately
Learning CPR can help save lives during cardiac emergencies
CPR certification requires hands-on practice with training mannequins
She administered CPR for ten minutes before paramedics arrived

definitions: central processing unit, the primary component of a computer that performs instructions and calculations
examples: The CPU temperature rose during intensive gaming sessions
Upgrading the CPU significantly improved computer performance
Modern CPUs contain billions of microscopic transistors
The CPU executes millions of instructions per second

definitions: cathode ray tube, vacuum tube containing electron guns used in older television and computer monitors
examples: CRT monitors were heavier but offered excellent color accuracy
The old CRT television finally stopped working after twenty years
Retro gamers prefer CRT displays for authentic visual experience
CRT technology dominated displays before LCD screens emerged

definitions: Central Standard Time, time zone six hours behind Coordinated Universal Time used in central North America
examples: The conference call is scheduled for 2 PM CST
Chicago operates on CST during the winter months
Convert PST to CST by adding two hours
The broadcast airs at 8 PM CST across the midwest

definitions: red wine grape variety, especially Cabernet Sauvignon, producing full-bodied wines with high tannins
examples: This cabernet pairs perfectly with grilled steak
The vineyard specializes in premium cabernet sauvignon
California produces world-class cabernet wines in Napa Valley
The cabernet aged for eighteen months in oak barrels

definitions: title used by Roman emperors, especially referring to Julius Caesar
salad typically made with romaine lettuce, croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing
caesarean section, surgical delivery of a baby through incisions in the abdomen
examples: Julius Caesar transformed Rome from republic to empire
The title Caesar became synonymous with imperial power
She ordered a chicken Caesar salad for lunch
The restaurant's Caesar dressing recipe remains a closely guarded secret
The doctor recommended a Caesar due to pregnancy complications
Her Caesar delivery was scheduled for next Tuesday morning

definitions: structure of bars or wires enclosing an area to confine or protect animals or objects
examples: The parrot squawked loudly from its ornate brass cage
Zoo workers cleaned the tiger cage during feeding time
The elevator cage descended slowly into the mine shaft
She felt trapped like a bird in a gilded cage

definitions: member of French-speaking community in Louisiana descended from Acadian exiles
spicy cuisine and cultural traditions originating from Louisiana Cajun communities
examples: The Cajun fisherman shared stories in his distinctive French dialect
Many Cajuns maintain strong family traditions passed through generations
The restaurant serves authentic Cajun gumbo and jambalaya
Cajun seasoning adds bold flavors to any dish

definitions: alcoholic drink made from fermented malt flavored with hops
examples: The craft beer featured complex flavors of chocolate and coffee
They enjoyed cold beer while watching the game
Local breweries produce dozens of unique beer varieties
The beer festival attracted thousands of enthusiasts last weekend

definitions: wax secreted by honeybees used to build honeycomb and various commercial products
examples: The furniture polish contained natural beeswax for protection

Artists use beeswax in encaustic painting techniques
The beeswax sealed the wood against moisture damage

definitions: plant with dark red edible root used as vegetable or source of sugar
examples: Roasted beets add earthy sweetness to the salad
The farmer harvested sugar beets for processing
Fresh beet juice provides numerous health benefits
She pickled beets using her grandmother's recipe

definitions: insect with hard wing covers belonging to the order Coleoptera
examples: The beetle crawled across the garden path slowly
Japanese beetles can damage roses and other plants
Scientists discovered a new beetle species in the rainforest
The scarab beetle held religious significance in ancient Egypt

definitions: person who lives by asking others for money or food
examples: The beggar sat quietly at the subway station entrance
Medieval cities had strict laws regulating where beggars could operate
She always gave spare change to the elderly beggar
The novel depicted the harsh life of Victorian beggars

definitions: practice of asking people to give money, food, or other items as charity
examples: Begging increased during the economic downturn
The city passed ordinances restricting begging in tourist areas
Street begging remains common in many urban centers worldwide
He resorted to begging after losing his job and home
